content: In the world of Harry Potter, what magical object was believed to grant immortality and unlimited wealth, sought after by Nicolas Flamel?

In the wizarding world of Harry Potter, the magical object believed to grant immortality and unlimited wealth is the Philosopher's Stone, also known as the Sorcerer's Stone in some editions. It was indeed sought after by the alchemist Nicolas Flamel, who used it to extend his life and amass a great fortune. The stone plays a central role in the first book of the series, "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone," where Harry and his friends must prevent it from falling into the wrong hands, specifically those of the dark wizard Voldemort.
